resources.string: Login failed. Please check your username and password, and try again.
Please enter user name and password for retroachievements.org below. Your password will not be saved in NetherSX2, an access token will be generated and used instead.
You have unlocked %1$d of %2$d achievements, earning %3$d of %4$d possible points.
Code name and body must not be empty.
Failed to add patch code, there may already be a code with this name, or the code is invalid.
Enter the patch code in PNACH format below, or choose a file to import codes from.
No vibrators found. Your controller or driver may not support vibration.
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device."
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device."
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
Are you sure you wish to delete this save state? It cannot be recovered.
Automatic mapping complete. You may still need to adjust some bindings.
No suitable devices found. Automatic binding only supports gamepad devices, but you can still bind other device types manually.

"Press button on controller to set new binding.
Current Binding: %s"
Are you sure you want to clear all bindings? This cannot be reversed.
All bindings cleared for Controller Port %d.
All bindings cleared for USB Port %d.
This will reset all controller settings, including the touchscreen. Do you want to continue?
Attempts to automatically map the pad to a selected controller.
Clears all bindings for this controller.
The selected device does not support vibration.
"Failed to create one or more directories, can't continue."
Transferring data allows you to easily move saves and game settings from one device to another.
"The file '%s' already exists, do you want to overwrite? Any existing data will be lost."

"In the form below, specify the URLs to download covers from, with one template URL per line. The following variables are available:
${title}: Title of the game. ${filetitle}: Name component of the game's filename. ${serial}: Serial of the game."
One or more URLs contains no variables.
No games in supported formats were found. Please add a directory with games to begin.
Using lightgun controller for %1$s in USB Port %2$d.

"Using patch codes can have unpredictable effects on games, causing crashes, graphical glitches, and corrupted saves. By using patch codes, you agree that it is an unsupported configuration, and we will not provide you with any assistance when games break.
Some codes persist through save states even after being disabled, please remember to reset/reboot the game after turning off any codes.
Are you sure you want to continue?"
Do you wish to save any changes made to this file?
Do you want to clear or set a new background image?
Failed to parse game settings ini.
Clears all settings set for this game.
Copies hotkey bindings to this game.
Copies the current global settings to this game.
Sets optimal defaults for this game.
Sets unsafe defaults for this game.
Replaces the current settings with the settings from a profile.
Loading an input profile will overwrite your current layout/bindings. Do you want to continue?
BIOS image is too large. You must select a BIOS image, not a game, and it should be 4MB in size.

"Game dumps in the following formats will be scanned and listed:
%s"
This BIOS image is invalid, or has already been imported.
No usable BIOS image was found. Do you wish to locate and import a BIOS image now?
Switch to clock mode for the time input.
Switch to text input mode for the time input.
Stores memory card contents as files on your device, instead of a single file.
Large, but incompatible with many games.
Supported by all games and BIOS versions.
Typical size for third-party memory cards, good compatibility.
If not set, this card will be considered unplugged.
"A memory card named '%s' already exists. Do you want to overwrite it? Any existing data will be lost."
Simulates a larger memory card by filtering saves to only the current game.
Imports a memory card from storage.
Quick swaps the memory cards in port 1 and 2.
Both ports must have a card selected to swap.
Tap to switch to selecting a day
Tap to switch to selecting a year
View the ad you saved when you were offline
"You'll get a notification with the link when you're back online"
"We'll send you a notification with a link to the advertiser site."
Clearing patches cannot be reversed, and all patches will be removed. Are you sure?
"Pnach path not found, make sure you're running a game."
Per-game controller configuration initialized with global settings.
You must be running a game to enable per-game configuration.
Resume save state does not exist.

"A save state was found for %1$s, saved at:
%2$s
Do you want to load this state and continue? "
Allow Ad to store image in Picture gallery?
Allow Ad to create a calendar event?
Saves the current settings to a profile, which can be chosen per-game.
No save present in this slot.
Failed to find a matching game for this serial/CRC.
Failed to get CRC/serial from path.
Selecting Yes will reset all settings to defaults. You will not be able to recover any changes.

"
You are choosing to use UNSAFE/FAST defaults.
This may improve performance, but WILL BREAK some games."
After logging out, no more achievements will be unlocked until you log back in again. Achievements already unlocked will not be lost.
NetherSX2 uses RetroAchievements (retroachievements.org) as an achievement database and for tracking progress.
Challenge mode for achievements, including leaderboard tracking. Disables save state, cheats, and slowdown functions.
When enabled and logged in, NetherSX2 will scan for achievements on startup.
Enables submission of leaderboards in hardcore mode for supported games. If disabled, you can still view leaderboards, but no scores will be uploaded.
Logs in to your account to record achievements.
Logs out of your account. No new achievements will be recorded.
Displays popup messages on events such as achievement unlocks and leaderboard submissions.
Opens a link to create a new account.
Rich presence information will be collected and sent to the server where supported.
Plays sound effects for events such as achievement unlocks and leaderboard submissions.
When enabled, NetherSX2 will assume all achievements are locked and not send any unlock notifications to the server.
List and activate unofficial sets. Note that these achievements are not tracked, so they unlock every time.
Opens a link to your profile.
Attempts to reverse blur/anti-flicker present in many games.
Reduces stutter when using replacement textures, but may result in pop-in.
Hides the touchscreen controller when an external controller is detected.
Binds touchscreen swipe gestures to the emulated right stick.
Writes status to log when disc reads occur.
Shows icons in the lower-right corner of the screen when a challenge/primed achievement is active.
Debugging feature - Enable debug reports from OpenGL driver.
Prevents use of dual-source blending when supported. Debugging option.
Disables the framebuffer fetch in blending shaders, falling back to multipass and texture barriers.
Removes the destination offset when using weave/blend deinterlacing.
Logs messages printed by the game from the EE.
Add/subtract instructions produce the same results as the console.
Performs just-in-time binary translation of 64-bit MIPS-IV machine code to native code.
Fast disc access, less loading times. Not recommended.
Uses memory aliasing and backpatching to reduce access overhead.
If disabled, the system will run as fast as possible.
Enables guests to access files outside of the directory with the ELF.
Performs just-in-time binary translation of 32-bit MIPS-I machine code to native code.
Recompiles VU microprograms to native code. Only disable for debugging.
Expands the display area to include the cutout (or notch) area.
Skips the BIOS shell/intro, booting directly into the game.
Writes log messages to emulog.txt in the external data directory. Reduces performance.
Smooths out the image by applying fast approximate anti-aliasing as a post-processing shader.
Applies palettes to textures on the GPU instead of the CPU. Slower than CPU palettes in most games.
Adjusts emulation speed so the guest refresh interval matches the host refresh rate.
Synchronizes frame presentation with host refresh.
Import a new BIOS file not currently in this list.
Faster, but can result in higher-than-console frame rates in some games.
Adds padding to the display area to ensure that the ratio between pixels on the host to pixels in the console is an integer number. May result in a sharper image in some 2D games.
Logs messages printed by the game from the IOP.
Writes log messages to device logcat. Reduces performance slightly.
Adds an extra three controller ports. Not compatible with all games.
Uses a second thread for VU1 micro programs. Sizeable speed boost.
Automatically no-interlacing patches in supported games.
Increases or decreases the size of on-screen messages/statistics.
"Controls the volume of the emulator's sound output."
Only use this option when asked by developers.
Saves state when shutting down a game, enabling you to continue where you left off.
Shows the CPU usage based on threads in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows the number of game frames (internal frame rate) and video frames (speed) in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows a visual history of frame times in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows the host GPU usage in the top-right corner of the display (may reduce performance).
Shows statistics about GS (primitives, draw calls) in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows indicators when running outside normal parameters (e.g. fast forward).
Shows the current controller input state in the bottom-left corner of the screen.
Shows on-screen-display messages when events occur such as save states being created/loaded, screenshots being taken, etc.
Shows typically-hidden overscan area when using screen offsets.
Shows the resolution the game is rendering at in the top-right corner of the display.
Shows a summary of settings in the bottom-right corner of the screen.
Shows the current emulation speed of the system in the top-right corner of the display as a percentage.
Shows software version and device model.
"Attempts to detect the game's internal framerate and skip presenting duplicate frames. Can be a huge performance win in some games/drivers."
Stops the use of a background thread for presenting frames when using the Vulkan renderer.
Allows you to press multiple controller face buttons by dragging your finger along the screen.
Hides touch controls after the specified time. A delay of zero will not hide the controls.
Adjusts the position for touchscreen buttons.
Controls the transparency level of the touchscreen controller.
Adjusts the scale for touchscreen buttons.
Changes button behavior from hold-to-press to tap-to-press.
"Forwards vibration from the game to your device's vibration motor, if present."
Enables a short vibration when a touchscreen button is pressed. Requires \"Vibrate on Touch\" to be enabled on your device.
Throttles the frequency at which vibration updates are sent. May help with controller disconnection/lag issues.
Displays OSD messages when unsafe settings are being used, which may break games.
Automatically applies 16:9 widescreen patches in supported games.
Adjusts the ratio of touch movement to stick pressure. Lower values imply more stick pressure.

"A BIOS image is required to play games and is not optional. This image should be dumped from your own console, using a homebrew application. There are plenty of guides available online on how to dump your console's BIOS."
Press finish to open the game list and start scanning for games. If you need to, you can re-run this setup wizard again from within App Settings.
Please read the following instructions before continuing. You can access this FAQ again from the navigation menu in the game list.

NetherSX2 will automatically detect games in the locations you specify here. You should add at least one directory to scan. Please do not add the top of your storage volume, otherwise scanning will take a very long time.
Use if you have a low end device. Game compatibility will be worse.

Please select a performance preset to use. We recommend the Optimal/Safe profile, as this will have the best game compatibility, but may not perform well on devices slower than a Snapdragon 845. The Fast/Unsafe profile may improve frame rates on low-end devices, at the cost of breaking games and inconsistent performance. You can reset the profile at any time in App Settings.
Use if you have a mid to high end device.
Just a few setup steps are necessary before you can play games.
This will reset all touchscreen layouts, any changes you have made will be lost.
Replaces the current layout with the defaults.
